name: Lowland Delta
role_in_state: Primary salt and riverine trade nexus
economy_niches: marsh-harvest of ritual reagents (peat, reeds, brackish herbs)
culture_adjustments: yearly labor cycle driven by flood recession rather than sowing dates
stronger guild control of landing rights and tolls than uplands
stilt-house and boat-based domestic organisation dominant
specialized oral mud-charts and tidal memory rites
wider acceptance of seasonally mobile kinship (boat-households)
constraints: limited high-ground for storage and ritual caches
guild monopolies restrict outsider ship access
ritual reagent harvests seasonally scarce and easily depleted
notes: critical supplier of salt and wetland reagents to state ritual markets
seasonal labor migration to upland harvests common
navigation relies on combined oral charts and local auguries
